meanings.definition: To run faster than someone else in a race.
meanings.sent1: During the race, Sarah outsprinted her competitors to win first place.
meanings.sent2: The cheetah outsprinted the gazelle to catch its prey.
meanings.sent3: The tortoise challenged the hare to a race, confident that he could outsprint him.
meanings.sent4: In the final stretch, the athlete outsprinted his own previous record.
meanings.sent5: The sound of the starting gun spurred him to outsprint his own limits.

meanings.definition: To surpass in speed or distance by running.
meanings.sent1: The Olympic champion outsprinted all his opponents in the marathon.
meanings.sent2: The car outsprinted the train to reach the finish line first.
meanings.sent3: The rabbit outsprinted the turtle, surprising everyone with its speed.
meanings.sent4: Her determination to succeed allowed her to outsprint any obstacles in her path.
meanings.sent5: The wind seemed to whisper encouragement as she outsprinted her doubts.
